meanings.definition: A low-lying meadow by a river.
meanings.sent1: The cows graze peacefully in the haughs by the stream.
meanings.sent2: The children love playing in the haughs near the water.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket spread out on the haughs kept sliding down the slope.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as refreshing as a cool breeze through the haughs.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers blooming in the haughs painted a beautiful picture.

meanings.sent1: The fishermen waited patiently at the haughs for the fish to swim by.
meanings.sent2: The canoe navigated smoothly around the haughs of the river.
meanings.sent3: The playful otters chased each other around the haughs, creating ripples in the water.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to flow like a lazy river through the haughs of memories.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the water as it curved around the haughs.

meanings.definition: A piece of land that is flat and fertile.
meanings.sent1: The farmers planted their crops in the haughs to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent2: The rich soil of the haughs yielded bountiful crops every season.
meanings.sent3: The children loved running and rolling down the haughs like a natural playground.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fertile haughs of ideas waiting to be cultivated.
meanings.sent5: The haughs stretched out like a green carpet under the open sky.
